snippet: On the first anniversary of protests that marked the start of the uprising in Syria, thousands gathered in the capital of Damascus Thursday to rally for the government of President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Thousands of Syrians, some under duress, gather to rally for the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad in Damascus on the first anniversary of the March 2011 protests that marked the start of the uprising in Syria.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Syria.

lead_paragraph: On the first anniversary of protests that marked the start of the uprising in Syria, thousands gathered in the capital of Damascus Thursday to rally for the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Syria Puts On Mass Rally in Support of Assad
headline.main: Damascus Puts on Pro-Assad Rally, but Protesters Won’t Be Silenced
headline.print_headline: Damascus Puts on Pro-Assad Rally, but Protesters Won’t Be Silenced

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
